about.heading: Turning ideas into clean, responsive web solutions.
about.intro: Hi! I’m Elham — a creative Full-Stack Developer with 3+ years of experience crafting responsive, user-focused web applications. With a strong foundation in UI/UX design, I specialize in building fast, accessible, and intuitive digital experiences that seamlessly bridge design and functionality — from sleek frontends to robust backends.
about.point1: I believe in writing clean, scalable code, collaborating openly, and continuously improving — whether it’s through code reviews, feedback, or diving into a new tech stack.
about.point2: I’m always open to interesting full-stack projects, design-driven products, or joining a team that values creativity and clean code.

projectOne.title: Find Food
projectOne.intro: This is a personal frontend project created to showcase my skills in modern web development. It is not used in production and was built to demonstrate how I work with frontend technologies, including layout, interactivity, and API integration.
projectOne.feature4: Local API integration using JSON Server
projectOne.repoDesc: The source code is available on GitHub. To view the project, clone the repo and run it locally.
projectOne.install2: Navigate to the project directory: cd project-one
projectOne.install4: Start the JSON Server API: npm run server
projectOne.install5: Start the React app: npm start

projectTwo.title: AI Post & Comment System
projectTwo.intro: This fullstack application allows users to create, view, update, and delete comments on AI-generated posts. It features a PostgreSQL database hosted on Neon, a Node.js backend, and a modern React frontend.
projectTwo.designAlt: Screenshot of the AI Post & Comment System interface
projectTwo.feature1: AI post display with unique text content
projectTwo.feature2: Users can add comments to the post
projectTwo.feature3: Edit and delete functionality for comments
projectTwo.feature4: Full CRUD operations using Sequelize and PostgreSQL
projectTwo.repoDesc: You can view the complete source code and contribute on GitHub:
projectTwo.install3: Run `npm install` in both directories to install dependencies.
projectTwo.install6: Create a `.env` file in the server with your Neon DB credentials.
projectTwo.install7: Run `npm run dev` in both `client/` and `server/` to start the app.
projectTwo.install8: Open `http://localhost:5173` in your browser to view the app.

projectThree.title: Pokémon Battle Game
projectThree.intro: This fullstack Pokémon battle simulator uses the PokeAPI to fetch data and allows users to build a team, battle random Pokémon, and track scores on a live leaderboard.
projectThree.designAlt: Screenshot of the Pokémon Battle Game
projectThree.feature1: Dynamic Pokémon list retrieved from PokeAPI
projectThree.feature2: Detailed Pokémon view including stats, types, and abilities
projectThree.feature3: Build and manage a custom roster with localStorage
projectThree.feature4: Simple battle system based on stats and type advantages
projectThree.feature5: MongoDB-based leaderboard to save and rank scores
